com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util.mock

Class MockRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.AbstractRequest
      • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.util.mock.MockRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Request

    public class MockRequest
extends AbstractRequest
    A mock request is useful when you want to write junits and the like. Normally the container running the components handles this, but in the case of junits, you are the container, so you must supply a request. MockRequest fills this requirement.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Martin Shevchenko, Rick Brown

      • getAttribute

        public Serializable getAttribute(String key)

        Returns the value of the named attribute as an Object, or null if no attribute of the given name exists.

        Attributes can be set two ways. The container may set attributes to make available custom information about a request. Attributes can also be set programatically using setAttribute.

        Parameters:
        key - the request attribute key
        Returns:
        an Object containing the value of the attribute, or null if the attribute does not exist

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(String key,
                Serializable value)
        Stores an attribute in this request. Attributes are reset between requests. If the object passed in is null, the effect is the same as removing the attribute.
        Parameters:
        key - the attribute key
        value - the attribute value

      • getSessionAttribute

        public Serializable getSessionAttribute(String key)
        Returns the object bound with the specified name in this session, or null if no object is bound under the name.
        Parameters:
        key - the session attribute key
        Returns:
        an Object containing the value of the attribute, or null if the attribute does not exist

      • getAppSessionAttribute

        public Serializable getAppSessionAttribute(String key)
        Note that this mock request just maps to the global session.
        Parameters:
        key - the attribute key
        Returns:
        the value of the session attribute with the given key

      • setSessionAttribute

        public void setSessionAttribute(String key,
                       Serializable value)
        Binds an object to this session, using the name specified. If an object of the same name is already bound to the session, the object is replaced.

        If the value passed in is null, this has the same effect as removing the attribute.

        Parameters:
        key - the session attribute key.
        value - an Object containing the value of the attribute.

      • setAppSessionAttribute

        public void setAppSessionAttribute(String key,
                          Serializable value)
        Note that this mock request just maps to the global session.
        Parameters:
        key - the session attribute key
        value - the value of the session attribute

      • setRenderParameter

        public void setRenderParameter(String key,
                      Serializable value)
        Deprecated. portal specific. user setSessionAttribute(String, Serializable)
        Support for Public Render Parameters in Portal. In a Servlet environment, this will be the same as the session.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the parameter.
        value - The value of the parameter.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • isUserInRole

        public boolean isUserInRole(String role)
        Returns true if the user is in the given role.
        Parameters:
        role - a String specifying the name of the role.
        Returns:
        true if the user is in the given role, otherwise false.

      • getMethod

        public String getMethod()
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Returns the name of the HTTP method with which this request was made, for example, GET, POST, or PUT. Same as the value of the CGI variable REQUEST_METHOD.
        Returns:
        the name of the HTTP method with which this request was made, for example, GET, POST, or PUT.

      • setMethod

        public void setMethod(String method)
        For a mock request, allow the method to be set.
        Parameters:
        method - the name of the HTTP method with which this request was made, for example, GET, POST, or PUT.

      • getMaxInactiveInterval

        public int getMaxInactiveInterval()
        Returns the maximum time interval, in seconds, that the servlet container will keep this session open between client accesses.
        Returns:
        an int specifying the maximum inactive interval in seconds. Negative if the session never expires.

      • setMaxInactiveInterval

        public void setMaxInactiveInterval(int interval)
        Set the mock maxInactiveInterval.
        Parameters:
        interval - the period in seconds to set as the maxInactiveInterval
